sentences: Loïc Nottet (French pronunciation: ​[lɔ.ik nɔtɛ]; born 10 April 1996) is a Belgian singer, songwriter and dancer.
He began his career as a singer in the third season of The Voice Belgique in 2014 and represented Belgium in the Eurovision Song Contest 2015, where he placed fourth with his song "Rhythm Inside".
He began his career as a singer in the third season of The Voice Belgique in 2014 and represented Belgium in the Eurovision Song Contest 2015, where he placed fourth with his song "Rhythm Inside".
His second studio album Sillygomania was released on 29 May 2020.

sentences: Nottet's single "Million Eyes", part of his first album, was released on 27 October 2016.
The video was filmed on 5 October 2016.
On the evening of 1 March 2017, Nottet announced his debut album, titled Selfocracy.
On the evening of 1 March 2017, Nottet announced his debut album, titled Selfocracy.
The album was released on 31 March and managed to top the chart in Belgian Albums (Ultratop Wallonia).
On 22 and 23 April 2017, Nottet presented his first concerts after the release of Selfocracy.
Nottet won the Best Belgian Act category at the 2017 MTV Europe Music Awards which aired on 12 November 2017.
Nottet won the Best Belgian Act category at the 2017 MTV Europe Music Awards which aired on 12 November 2017.
Throughout 2017, Nottet toured in Belgium, the UK, France, Germany and more in support of Selfocracy.
The tour finished in early August 2018.
2018–present: Sillygomania and Candy ===
In October 2019, Nottet announced "Candy", a Halloween-themed extended play.
In October 2019, Nottet announced "Candy", a Halloween-themed extended play.
The EP was released on 31 October, alongside a musical short film of the same name, which premiered the same day on YouTube.
The EP was released on 31 October, alongside a musical short film of the same name, which premiered the same day on YouTube.
